short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Floating label to indicatie the environment (Development, Test, Acceptance or Production).

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
#Usage
> Open a website
> Labels will be shown for websites specified in the options menu.
> Drag the label across the website if it is in front of something.
 

#Installation
Install browser extension from Chrome WebStore.

#Options
You will need to specify the options to see any labels.
Open the options menu of the extension (right mouse click on the 
extensions icon (puzzle) and click on the dots behind the extension name.
Enter values for "Environment Labels" like:
 label=Development | color=#EA7500 | icon=Dev | locations=www.java.com
 label=Test        | color=#B47804 | icon=Tst | locations=www.oracle.com
 label=Acceptance  | color=#168253 | icon=Acc | locations=www.opentext.com,suport.opentext.com
 label=Production  | color=#780373 | icon=Prd | locations=www.unisys.com
And "Highlight objects" (if wanted) :
 type=id    | name=u30w1      | description=Oracle header bar
 type=class | name=sitenav    | description=OpenText header bar
You can show these examples by clicking on the middle icon in the header bar
on the upper right side of the options page. 
Click on it again to restore the original values.
